content: The Act may be cited as the "American Savings Promotion Act". Congress finds that the annual savings rate in the United States was 4.1 percent in 2012, with over 40 percent of American households lacking savings to cover basic expenses for 3 months. Personal savings are crucial for future needs like education and homeownership, as well as providing a safety net for unexpected financial shocks. Prize-linked savings products, offered by financial institutions, provide chances to win prizes based on deposit activity, with Michigan being the first state to allow credit unions to offer such products. Prize-linked savings products are offered by credit unions, with several states allowing financial institutions to offer them. Michigan and Nebraska have seen success with over 42,000 individuals opening accounts and saving $72 million. These products attract non-savers and low-to-moderate income groups, promoting personal savings which is in the national interest of the United States. Amendment to definitions of "lottery" is proposed. The amendment defines a "savings promotion raffle" as a contest where depositing a specified amount of money in a savings account gives a chance to win prizes, subject to regulations by the appropriate regulator.
